Question_1.Context: The study focused on evaluating the influence of Molded Pulp Products' manufacturing process parameters on mechanical and hygroscopic properties using bleached softwood Chemi-Thermo-Mechanical Pulp.
Question_1.Question: What was one of the specific process parameters tested in the study?
Question_1.Source: The results of these tests were used to obtain an optimized manufacturing process with improved mechanical properties and a lower water uptake after sorption analysis and water immersion.

Question_2.Context: The study aimed to propose new products with a lower environmental impact by using wood cellulose fiber for manufacturing.
Question_2.Question: What is the main advantage of using Chemi-Thermo-Mechanical Pulping (CTMP) over chemical pulps?
Question_2.Source: It has replaced some chemical pulps for several applications as it is a less-expensive pulp to produce with a much higher yield of pulp produced.

Question_3.Context: The study mentioned different categories of Molded Pulp Products (MPPs) based on the manufacturing process used.
Question_3.Question: Which category of MPPs is described as having a smooth side in contact with the mold and a rougher side?
Question_3.Source: "Thick-wall": made using one mould resulting in a smooth side (in contact with mould) and a rougher side.

Question_4.Context: The study discussed the influence of process parameters on the sorption behavior of Molded Pulp Products.
Question_4.Question: Which factor had a better impact at lower temperature for water activity of 0.1 to 0.5?
Question_4.Source: The mould B temperature has a better impact at lower temperature for aw of 0.1 to 0.5.

Question_5.Context: The study analyzed the mechanical properties of Molded Pulp Products based on different process parameters.
Question_5.Question: What effect did a longer pulping time have on the Young's Modulus of the samples?
Question_5.Source: A lower amount and size of pores as well as longer fibers given by a shorter pulping time is beneficial for a higher Young’s Modulus.

Question_6.Context: The study discussed the optimization of manufacturing process parameters for improved properties of Molded Pulp Products.
Question_6.Question: How many tests were performed to confirm the theoretical results obtained from the Taguchi method?
Question_6.Source: With the experimental results of these 8 specific tests, the Taguchi Table allowed us to obtain theoretical results of all the other tests possibilities. Two final tests with optimized process parameters from the initial 8 were done to confirm the Taguchi method used for this study.

Question_7.Context: The study aimed to optimize the hygroscopic and mechanical properties of BCTMP without using additives.
Question_7.Question: What was the main objective of the study regarding the Molded Pulp Products?
Question_7.Source: This study allowed us to optimize the hygroscopic and mechanical properties of BCTMP without using additives and by optimizing the manufacturing process.

Question_8.Context: The study discussed the influence of process parameters on the sorption behavior of Molded Pulp Products.
Question_8.Question: What variable in the GAB equation had the highest impact on water uptake for higher water activity?
Question_8.Source: When pressure is applied, the product’s density increased, and pore size reduced. As a result, these modifications in the samples morphology either improved or decreased the mechanical properties.

Question_9.Context: The study aimed to optimize the hygroscopic and mechanical properties of BCTMP without using additives.
Question_9.Question: What was the outcome of test n°9 with optimized process parameters?
Question_9.A: Lower water uptake and higher Young's Modulus
Question_9.B: Higher water uptake and lower Young's Modulus
Question_9.Source: With test n°10 the water uptake was on average 70% lower than all 8 tests made with the Taguchi table as well as a Young’s modulus after 30h immersion 58% higher.

Question_10.Context: The study discussed the optimization of manufacturing process parameters for improved properties of Molded Pulp Products.
Question_10.Question: What was the purpose of the two final tests performed after the initial 8 tests?
Question_10.Source: Two final tests with optimized process parameters from the initial 8 were done to confirm the Taguchi method used for this study.
